team.headline: Our Team
team.description: NU ACM-W SC is the first Kazakhstani branch of the largest international organization which aims to provide social and professional support for women in computer technology, computer science, and engineering, as well as to facilitate their technical growth by organizing different activities.

about.description: codeW 2023 is the fourth annual national competition in competitive programming for the university and high school female students. During the competition, the participants will solve a set of problems on algorithms and data structures in their chosen programming language.

questions.a: High school students (grades 9-12), university foundation students, undergraduate, and graduate students residing in Kazakhstan (not necessarily with Kazakhstani citizenship) eligible for participation.

questions.q: Can I participate if I am new to programming?
questions.a: Yes, we encourage everyone interested in programming to join us.  All you need to know is the basics of at least one Object-oriented programming language. There will be three tracks depending on your level: novice, intermediate, experienced (see details above). Your level will be determined according to the results of qualifier test on HackerRank.

questions.q: What is the format of codeW 2023?
questions.a: This year codeW will be held in hybrid mode, with participants who choose the online format not being eligible for prizes. The online participants will only receive certificates of participation.
codeW 2023 will be conducted at the Nazarbayev University campus, Astana, Kazakhstan.

questions.q: Do I have to know English?
questions.a: No, you donâ€™t have to. codeW will be held in three different languages: English, Kazakh, and Russian. All tasks and materials from workshops will be translated into Kazakh and Russian languages.

questions.q: How do I know which track is suitable for me?
questions.a: If you got selected, you will receive a link to the preliminary challenge that will identify your level and we will match you to a suitable track.

questions.q: What programming languages are accepted in the contest?
questions.a: The contest will be held using Hackerrank, and the accepted programming languages include Java, Python, and C++.
